pr_title: Fix langlib functions to support readonly

timeline.bodyText:
Is this change needed? The inherent type of a value cannot change once the value is created, so IMO, we shouldn't have such a method (which allows changing the type) in the public API.
If your requirement is to create an immutable value, IMO it should be done by allowing the user to pass both the type and the values and internally calling the relevant constructors that accept the same;

io.ballerina.runtime.values.ArrayValueImpl#ArrayValueImpl(io.ballerina.runtime.api.types.ArrayType, long, io.ballerina.runtime.values.ListInitialValueEntry[])
io.ballerina.runtime.values.MapValueImpl#MapValueImpl(io.ballerina.runtime.api.types.Type, io.ballerina.runtime.api.values.BMapInitialValueEntry[])
timeline.author: MaryamZi

replies.bodyText: With the clarification from spec issue #646 we wouldn't need this API.

timeline.bodyText: Do we have set of methods we need to support read only?. I can see array reverse also we create array value with given array type without using element type. @MaryamZi @HindujaB

replies.bodyText:
The doc does not specifically say that we return a new array (unlike some other functions as filter, map etc.).
So I found that currently we are not allowing the usage of reverse functionality for readonly types from front-end.
https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/api-docs/ballerina/lang.array/functions.html#reverse

replies.bodyText: With reverse I think there's actually a spec deviation, we shouldn't be returning a new array. See #26843.
